pytzdata.name: pytzdata
pytzdata.description: The Olson timezone database for Python.

repo.name: pytzdata
repo.description: Official timezone database for Python.

readme.summary: Clear and concise documentation with good basic examples, but lacks troubleshooting guidance and deeper use case coverage.
readme.top_issue: No troubleshooting section - no guidance on common errors, timezone lookup failures, or debugging approaches

common_complaints: Outdated Olson database versions (requests from 2019, 2022 still open)
Critical timezone data errors (wrong offsets, incorrect zone names)
Long-standing unfixed issues (license file missing since 2018, localtime deleted in 2018.3)
Build dependency misconfigurations (poetry listed as runtime dependency)
No updates to support Python 3.9+ zoneinfo module
sentiment.summary: The project shows severe abandonment with multiple critical unfixed issues spanning 6+ years, no responsiveness to maintenance requests, and outdated timezone data that directly impacts users.

concerns: No commits in over 12 months (last commit January 2024)
No activity in past 6 months across all metrics
No merged PRs or releases in past 6 months
Zero active contributors in past 6 months
maintenance.summary: pytzdata is abandoned with no maintenance activity for over a year and unresolved open issues.

project_metrics.description: Official timezone database for Python.

concerns: High bus factor risk (95% from top contributor)
